repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Cannot enter "more" window while cmdwin is open since it is a
          regular window and changing windows is disallowed.
Solution: Close cmdwin to enter the "more" window. Minor regression
          w.r.t. the current message grid. Resolving that will require
          somehow bypassing textlock for the "more" window.

Fix #33853

comment_data.body:
Sites that check `text_locked` will need an audit (which also includes API functions with the `FUNC_API_TEXTLOCK` attribute).

For example, `nvim_buf_delete` can now be used to delete the cmdwin buffer, leaving us still restricted with `cmdwin_type` still set:

```vim
lua require"vim._extui".enable{}
echom "foo"
call feedkeys("q:", "nt")
au CmdwinEnter * ++once let b = bufnr() | mess | call nvim_buf_delete(b, #{force: 1})
      \| exe 'au SafeState * ++once au SafeState * ++once mes'
      "\ cmdwin buffer deleted, but still E11
      \| only!
```

As a result, I think it might (also) be a good idea to also change `cmdwin_lock` to instead take a window/buffer handle, and allow _only_ navigating between that window/buffer and the cmdwin. (As currently when in the messages window, API functions outside of `vim._extui` can also be used without restrictions to go to other windows, etc.)

Also, dunno if it's _technically_ possible to get here with `curwin == NULL`, though I'd imagine `cmdwin_lock` *would* be set in that case, which might cause a false positive?

Can use this to close other windows when in the messages window, which can allow for `cmdwin_old_curwin` to be closed or the cmdwin to be left as the only window; that can cause strangeness.

E.g: this causes E199, which shouldn't happen:

```vim
only!
lua require"vim._extui".enable{}
echom "foo"
call feedkeys("q:", "nt")
au CmdwinEnter * ++once mess | 1q! | qa! | au SafeState * ++once au SafeState * ++once mes
```

Same here:

```vim
only!
lua require"vim._extui".enable{}
echom "foo"
call feedkeys("q:", "nt")
au CmdwinEnter * ++once mess | 1close! | qa! | au SafeState * ++once au SafeState * ++once mes
```
With my suggestion from earlier, might be better to make this `cmdwin_nolock_win`/`buf` instead (can bikeshed the naming), and only allow navigation between that window/buffer and the cmdwin?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -743,6 +743,7 @@ EXTERN bool km_startsel INIT( = false);
 EXTERN int cmdwin_type INIT( = 0);    ///< type of cmdline window or 0
 EXTERN int cmdwin_result INIT( = 0);  ///< result of cmdline window or 0
 EXTERN int cmdwin_level INIT( = 0);   ///< cmdline recursion level
+EXTERN bool cmdwin_lock INIT( = true);   ///< should lock for open cmdwin

comment_data.body: Likewise, this allows entering other windows once in the messages window with `<C-W>w` and the like.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -213,7 +213,7 @@ void do_window(int nchar, int Prenum, int xchar)
 
 #define CHECK_CMDWIN \
   do { \
-    if (cmdwin_type != 0) { \
+    if (curwin == cmdwin_win && cmdwin_lock) { \

comment_data.body: Also on a related note, I wonder if `'winfixbuf'` should be set on the messages window?

Thanks for the review! I remember contemplating 'winfixbuf' but don't remember the reason for omitting it, if I had oneðŸ˜“ The correct buffer is restored for all extui windows on the next event anyways so switching the buffer shouldn't break anything but I also cant think of a reason to allow it.

A _slightly_ pedantic nitpick (sorry! :grin:), but it's possible for the cmdwin to not be curwin (but only temporarily).

E.g: (run this one manually)

```vim
lua require'vim._extui'.enable{}
let s:w = win_getid()
call feedkeys('q:', 'nt')
au CmdwinEnter * ++once call win_execute(s:w, 'messages')
```

_Should_ be able to get around that by just using a plain `:quit` instead (it prioritizes the cmdwin regardless of curwin), but looping through the list of windows to `nvim_win_close` the one with `win_gettype() == "command"` may be more robust.

Yeah, the cmdwin is a bit jank...
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -405,17 +405,24 @@ function M.set_pos(type)
       local row = (texth.all > height and texth.end_row or 0) + 1
       api.nvim_win_set_cursor(ext.wins[ext.tab].box, { row, 0 })
     elseif type == 'more' and api.nvim_get_current_win() ~= win then
-      api.nvim_create_autocmd('WinEnter', {
-        once = true,
-        callback = function()
-          if api.nvim_win_is_valid(win) then
-            api.nvim_win_set_config(win, { hide = true })
-          end
-          append_more = 0
-        end,
-        desc = 'Hide inactive more window.',
-      })
-      api.nvim_set_current_win(win)
+      -- Cannot leave the cmdwin to enter the "more" window, so close it.
+      if fn.getcmdwintype() ~= '' then
+        api.nvim_win_close(0, true)

comment_regular_data.body:
wdyt @seandewar  ? 

is this RFC and then tests/docs will be updated?

title: fix(extui): close cmdwin to enter "more" window
